Chris Bryant, who believes he may have been a victim of the phone hackers, said Friday he welcomed the decision to re-examine the case, adding that it should not have been closed last month. The evidence that this goes far deeper than one rotten apple has continued to stack up, and so a fresh pair of eyes looking at the case is very welcome, he said. As executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. We've got very complicated government issues, he said, adding that "we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale."
